titleStmt.title: Certein places gathered out of .S. Austens boke intituled de essentia diuinitatis verye necessary to vnderstand certein darke places of the byble and especiallye the Prophetes gachered [sic] by Herman Bodius a faithfull preacher. and now lately turned into Inglysh.
Unio dissidentium. Selections. English.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A17610 of text S108128 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 4380). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 24 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 16 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: Certein places gathered out of .S. Austens boke intituled de essentia diuinitatis verye necessary to vnderstand certein darke places of the byble and especiallye the Prophetes gachered [sic] by Herman Bodius a faithfull preacher. and now lately turned into Inglysh.
Unio dissidentium. Selections. English.
titleStmt.author: Augustine, Saint, Bishop of Hippo, attributed name.
Jerome, Saint, d. 419 or 20, attributed name.
Ambrose, Saint, Bishop of Milan, d. 397,
Bodius, Herman.
Bucer, Martin, 1491-1551.

publicationStmt.publisher: At the signe of the Hyll, at the west dore of Paules. By Wyllyam Hill. And there to be sold,

notesStmt.note: Not in fact by Augustine. Also sometimes attributed to Sts. Jerome, Ambrose, and others.
A translation from the last article in "Unio dissidentium" edited by Hermannus Bodius [i.e. Martin Bucer?].
At foot of title: Cum gratia et priuilegio ad imprimendum solum.
Variant: the second "u" in "Austens" is turned.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
